intro: Octarrhena gracilis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and inconspicuous yellow flowers. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Octarrhena gracilis is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
